DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric value that describes the weight of an individual.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by the mass of an individual as a result of gravity.

Property.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 7/6/23 used in an NCI Standard CDE; chg RS to Standard and txfr ownership to NCI Standards to support DSS reuse. jk

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The weight of a subject._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Body Weight Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The weight of a subject.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
